title: How to Organize Small Spaces

steps.headline: Select the area you want to tidy.
steps.description: It might be your wardrobe, office, kitchen, craft room etc.

steps.headline: Examine the "before" state.
steps.description: Look at it in its cluttered form and ask yourself if there is anything you can get rid of, recycle, donate to a charity etc that would mean less items to look after.

steps.headline: Tidy it by removing everything first.
steps.description: Place all items into a large box.

steps.headline: Clean the area.
steps.description: Wipe it down, dust, etc. until it's dust-free and clean.

steps.headline: Look at the effect now.
steps.description: Decide if you might need to get new storage furniture or boxes or do any maintenance work like painting.

steps.headline: Start sorting the items in the box.
steps.description: Consider what you want to add back into this small space and what needs to live elsewhere or be recycled. Try to at least halve what is being returned, or even more.

steps.headline: Get a friend in to help you for emotional support.
steps.description: For true hoarders, it's painful to get rid of old things.

steps.headline: Make use of storage boxes and baskets.
steps.description: These make it easier to keep a small space orderly, as well as making it easier to retrieve things especially where the space is cramped. Try to get boxes that you can stack easily.

steps.headline: Dust each item before placing it back.
Label each box, or write the boxes contents on a small piece of card so you can quickly reference the contents.
Once everything has been stacked back in neatly, examine the "After" effect and congratulate yourself for finishing the job.
Keep up with your tidying.
steps.description: What comes out of the box goes back into the box and the box goes back on the shelf.

text: Select the area you want to tidy. It might be your wardrobe, office, kitchen, craft room etc. Examine the "before" state. Look at it in its cluttered form and ask yourself if there is anything you can get rid of, recycle, donate to a charity etc that would mean less items to look after. Tidy it by removing everything first. Place all items into a large box. Clean the area. Wipe it down, dust, etc. until it's dust-free and clean. Look at the effect now. Decide if you might need to get new storage furniture or boxes or do any maintenance work like painting. Start sorting the items in the box. Consider what you want to add back into this small space and what needs to live elsewhere or be recycled. Try to at least halve what is being returned, or even more. Get a friend in to help you for emotional support. For true hoarders, it's painful to get rid of old things. Make use of storage boxes and baskets. These make it easier to keep a small space orderly, as well as making it easier to retrieve things especially where the space is cramped. Try to get boxes that you can stack easily. Dust each item before placing it back.  Label each box, or write the boxes contents on a small piece of card so you can quickly reference the contents.  Once everything has been stacked back in neatly, examine the "After" effect and congratulate yourself for finishing the job.  Keep up with your tidying. What comes out of the box goes back into the box and the box goes back on the shelf.
